sub_title: Junior Well Performance Engineer - R&D/CCS | Reservoir Engineer | Upstream | Oil & Gas | Energy Industry
summary:
A young ambitious petroleum engineering graduate from Uzbekistan. Determined to serve people globally by providing sustainable energy and contributing to the development of the enegy industry worldwide. 

Leadership, creativity and high competency are my pillars; optimism and persistence are my success formula.

treasury_media.title: Student Chapter Excellence Award
treasury_media.description: Receiving this award for the first time in our section's history.

treasury_media.title: MOOC Energy Transition - Innovation Towards a Low-Carbon Future
Branch of Gubkin University in Tashkent city.pdf
treasury_media.description: Regional qualifier of the famous Petrobowl competition by the Society of Petroleum Engineers (SPE). Were in 6th place in overall ranking.

treasury_media.title: Certificate of Appreciation.pdf
treasury_media.description: During almost 3 hours I talked about my Global UGRAD exchange experience and held a workshop on how to write motivation letters based on my experience to a group of my peers.

treasury_media.title: SPE Regional Student Development Summit 2020.pdf
treasury_media.description: On the focus of this summit was a case championship specially designed by the regional industry professionals from Baker Hughes, KazMunayGaz, Lukoil Uzbekistan OC, and Cairn Energy India. Working in a team of 4 students (Azerbaijan, Russian, Uzbekistan), we carried out rigorous investment analysis of three oil fields, assessing them from geology to economy in less than three days. As a result, we won second place (5 teams overall).

treasury_media.title: Global UGRAD Omon Ochilov.pdf
treasury_media.description: An exchange semester at the University of Wyoming under the prestigious Global UGRAD program sponsored by the US Department of State.

treasury_media.title: Omon Ochilov Erasmus+ Volunteering Certificate.pdf
treasury_media.description: My work was mainly focused on dissemination activities, including drafting publications for NEO's social media by screening Erasmus resources, announcing the latest news from local partners, and attending various events like conferences, meetings with experts. In addition, every Tuesday I consulted students on Erasmus opportunities.

education.field_of_study: Bioeconomy. Sustainable Use of Biological Resources

school.name: Gubkin Russian State University of Oil and Gas (National Research University)

awards.title: Sponsorship by TotalEnergies
awards.description: First-ever sponsorship to a student from Uzbekistan to cover master's studies at IFP School with end-of-studies internship in reservoir engineering.

awards.title: Student Section Excellence Award
awards.description: Receiving this award for the first time in our section's history (given only to 20% of chapters globally).

awards.title: TechnoBATtle case championship, 3rd place
awards.description: The task was to streamline the manufacturing of a new product (packaging line modeling, timeline) and design its entry to the Russian market (logistics and distribution, marketing). All in all, we were given 1 week on the first stage and only 3 more hours on the final day to finalize the solution with new data that required additional financial analysis. Competing with the best students from Turin Polytechnic University in Tashkent and INHA University in Tashkent, we once again proved that petroleum engineers are able to proficiently solve any kind of problem.

awards.title: Global UGRAD Finalist, Full Scholarship
awards.description: A highly prestigious full scholarship for undergraduate students funded by the US Department of State to study one semester at the US university every year. Given to bright students from over 60 countries who have demonstrated outstanding leadership potential in their communities. I was one of the 7 finalists from my country.

awards.title: SPE Russia and Caspian Regional Student Development Summit, 2nd place
awards.description: Case championship specially designed by the regional industry professionals from Baker Hughes, KazMunayGaz, Lukoil Uzbekistan OC, and Cairn Energy India. Working in a team of 4 students (Azerbaijan, Russia, Uzbekistan), we carried out rigorous investment analysis of three oil fields, assessing them from geology to economy in less than three days. As a result, we won second place (5 teams overall).

awards.title: Full Tuition Scholarship by the Government of Uzbekistan
awards.description: A 100% tuition waiver granted upon admission to Gubkin University in Tashkent. I was ranked 4th (out of 50) in the admission list for the "Operation and Maintenance of Oil Production Facilities" program at my university.

Projects: miscible gas injection studies (HC gas, CO2), upscaling, uncertainty analysis, conventional & assisted history matching, field development, 3D static model construction, well test interpretation (6 wells), well log interpretation, rock typing, black oil PVT tables generation & matching

contributors.headline: Junior Well Performance Engineer - R&D/CCS | Reservoir Engineer | Upstream | Oil & Gas | Energy Industry

projects.title: Gas cycling compositional simulation, SPE 12278
projects.description:
Software: Eclipse 300, PVTI, RE Studio

The project was focued on reproducing gas cycling scenarios studied in the SPE 12278 paper. The main objective was to follow the component lumping strategy of one of the 9 companies and compare the results of PVT modelling to laboratory test results. My team studied the case of Chevron.

contributors.headline: Junior Well Performance Engineer - R&D/CCS | Reservoir Engineer | Upstream | Oil & Gas | Energy Industry

projects.title: BS diploma thesis - Assessment of CO2-EOR efficiency in Mullahol oil field
projects.description:
CO2-EOR is considered to be a prospective method to increase oil recovery and also maintain production in mature fields. Due to its high solubility in oil (higher than methane and nitrogen), it causes oil swelling, reduces oil viscosity, and also reduces IFT (dissolving in water and forming weak carbonic acid). 

In my diploma thesis, I reviewed the technology of injection of carbon dioxide into the reservoir as a method of increasing the recovery in the Mullahol oil field, Uzbekistan. The minimum miscibility pressure, PVT properties of oil (gas saturation, volumetric ratio, viscosity) in contact with carbon dioxide in reservoir conditions were calculated, an assessment of the ultimate oil recovery was made, and the type of compressor for gas injection was proposed.

contributors.headline: Junior Well Performance Engineer - R&D/CCS | Reservoir Engineer | Upstream | Oil & Gas | Energy Industry

profile_positions.description:
Working in R&D department with focus on CO2 injectivity issues
• Study the mechanisms of hydrates formation during the CO2 injection to de-risk CCS projects using flow assurance (Olga, LedaFlow) and reservoir simulation tools (Reveal, CMG Stars)
• Imrove robustness of CO2 injection profiles and associated completion designs
profile_positions.title: Junior Well Performance Engineer - R&D/CCS

profile_positions.description:
Achievement: validated the proposed aquifer development scheme and updated the reservoir model
• Conducted sensitivity study to evaluate inter-well interference using reservoir simulation (Intersect)
• Collected historical pressure data in field database with rigorous QC, built dashboards in Power BI
• Assisted preparation of an acquisition program for WT/WPLog collaborating with an expert remotely
profile_positions.title: Reservoir Engineering Intern - Integrated Studies

profile_positions.description:
• Coordinated and participated in school's PetroBowl team (5 people): communication, documentation, budgeting, logistics. Third (3rd) place in European region, qualified for international competetion of 2022 at ATCE, Houston, USA
• Led a company visit to SLB Technology Center in Clamart for a group of 25 students  
• Planned, developed and co-hosted the second edition of the Student Chapters Development Workshop (SCDW) together with Universitat Indonesia chapter. The event featured SPE 2021 President Thomas A. Blasingame, SPE France President Olivier Lodeho and others gathering 21 student chapters from 7 regions of the world (Europe, Americas, Africa, Middle East, South East Asia) achieving a huge success in experience exchange and networking
• Organized technical seminars/webinars with industry specialists (Vermillion Energy, TotalEnergies, Sage Geosystems)
profile_positions.title: Vice President (External)

profile_positions.description:
Student Chapter Excellence Award (20% globally) for the first time in the history of the chapter
• Organized 30+ educational and technical events locally managing a team of 15 students (under 500 attendees overall)
• Implemented a new membership campaign with the HR officer, improving membership stats by 75%
• Developed regional and international integration of the section through participation in student forums and competitions
profile_positions.title: President at Gubkin University in Tashkent SPE Student Chapter

profile_positions.description:
Opened in January 2019, Frontier Uzbekistan monitors the energy market of Uzbekistan, providing subscription-based business intelligence services through Uzbekistan Energy Monitor (https://energy.frontieruzbekistan.com) 

The monitor features daily news, company information, project profiles, tenders, analysis, data. This is coupled with customised research and consulting offering, using local staff with strong local knowledge.

Headquartered in the UK, Frontier is a business publishing, research and advisory firm covering some of the world's fastest-growing economies. 

My duties in the company included:
•	Identifying, contacting and meeting potential clients
•	Setting up trials on monitor websites
•	Assisting the Business Development Director on admin tasks
•	Presenting subscription and customised research services
• Working with the research and editorial team on content creation
profile_positions.title: Business Development Assistant

profile_positions.description:
• Reviewed development plans, well inventory, production histories of 4 heavy oil fields
• Assisted the geology department in production planning and reporting
• Studied and participated in well completion under the supervision of the chief geologist
profile_positions.title: Summer Intern

profile_positions.description:
• Established partnerships and sponsorships with companies involved in oil and gas in Uzbekistan
• Ran Petro English club at university, a student club designed to introduce students to the petroleum industry in English
• Closely dealt with organizing educational events by the chapter at various levels, starting from assistant to chief responsible
• Kept documentation of every event held
profile_positions.title: Communications Chairperson at Gubkin University in Tashkent SPE Student Chapter

volunteer_experiences.description: In a tandem with an American colleague, I led practical sessions of community project development for a group of 10 students coming from almost all 12 regions of Uzbekistan for 3 full days.

Feeding Laramie Valley grows vegetables on their own and on people's yards to distribute them to those in need for free. As it was harvest time, I helped them harvest various vegetables. I got to know a new vegetable - squash. It is not something we grow back home.
As part of my community service plan, I joined the kitchen once in early October and helped them as a dishwasher.

company.name: Service, Leadership, Community Engagement (SLCE) - University of Wyoming

volunteer_experiences.description: I took part in a series of monthly events called Service Saturday. During those days I mostly cleaned the canyon areas from litter, helped a family in Laramie, Wyoming, to clean their front yard, and also collected donations at SafeWay store for Thanksgiving dinner for the needy. I enjoyed this experience as I learned to appreciate the volunteering and the goodwill of people. In addition, I made new friends and started feeling like a part of the community.

• Consulted students and higher education institutions on Erasmus+ opportunities
• Prepared news for NEO social media pages and updated NEO Facebook and Telegram pages
• Supported organization of conferences, meetings, and education fairs organized by NEO and Higher Education Reform Experts (HEREs)
• Translated various materials into Russian, Uzbek, and vice versa
